body: "\nIn the context of a job function, a function refers to a specific set of responsibilities or tasks associated with a particular role or position. A promotion refers to an increase in rank, status, or position within an organization. In the context of a job function, a promotion typically involves taking on additional responsibilities or tasks associated with a higher level or position within the same job function. For example, if an individual is promoted from the position of a sales associate to the position of a sales manager, they would likely be expected to take on additional responsibilities such as managing a team of sales associates, setting sales goals, and developing sales strategies."
